question:
Competitive SIS model over two multiplex layer A and B same set of nodes. the two memes are exclusive: A node cannot adopt meme 1 and meme 2 simultaneously. Beta 1 and delta 1 for layer 1 and beta2 and delta 2 for layer 2 Assume the effective adoption rates of each meme are larger than their no-sharing mean field threshold, i.e., ùúè1>1/ùúÜ1(ùê¥) and ùúè2>1/ùúÜ1(ùêµ).Question1-:  Will both memes survive (coexistence), or will one meme completely remove the other (absolute dominance)?2-which characteristics of a multilayer network structure allow for coexistence?
 This question need to be addressed analytically and then simulated to see if the analytical solutions are also valid by simualtion comprehensively.
 please do not ask the user any question, use other tools to address the question
next_plan: Completed discovery, modeling, simulation for two scenarios; extracted preliminary metrics indicating dominance/extinction. Next iteration: refine analytical derivations of survival and winning thresholds; compute them for our networks; run additional simulations varying eigenvector overlap and beta ratios to map phase diagram; perform comprehensive analysis; then generate full IEEE-style LaTeX report including all sections and references.

question: Competitive SIS model over two multiplex layer A and B same set of nodes. the two memes are exclusive: A node cannot adopt meme 1 and meme 2 simultaneously. Beta 1 and delta 1 for layer 1 and beta2 and delta 2 for layer 2 Assume the effective adoption rates of each meme are larger than their no-sharing mean field threshold, i.e., ùúè1>1/ùúÜ1(ùê¥) and ùúè2>1/ùúÜ1(ùêµ).Question1-:  Will both memes survive (coexistence), or will one meme completely remove the other (absolute dominance)?2-which characteristics of a multilayer network structure allow for coexistence?
next_plan: Analytical computation of survival and winning thresholds completed showing dominance predicted (no coexistence). Additional simulations varying eigenvector overlap built; batch results confirm dominance of meme on layer B. Next: perform simulations for scenarios with lower cross-layer eigenvector correlation (B2, B4, B3) and varied beta ratios to find coexistence region; collect metrics; prepare figures and then craft full LaTeX report with citation of Sahneh2013 and others.
